title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 85.1 - Signs required
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 85.1 - Signs required

State Regulations

No vehicle registered with the Liquor Authority pursuant
to section
94
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law
shall be used for trucking or transportation of any alcoholic beverage within
this State, unless there shall be affixed to or inscribed upon both sides of
such vehicle, or, if the vehicle consists of a separate cab and trailer, unless
affixed to or inscribed upon both sides of the cab, a sign bearing the
following inscription: "New York State Liquor Authority Trucking Permit No... ", and the current calendar year for which such permit number was issued, in
uniform letters not less than one inch in height. Such sign shall be 10 inches
by 7 inches in size, or, if an inscription, such inscription shall be
circumscribed by a rectangle 10 inches by 7 inches in size, and such sign or
inscription shall be in the following form: NEW YORK STATE
LIQUOR AUTHORITY
1945
TRUCKING PERMIT NO. 1234

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
85.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
